content:
Trust and Privacy in Networks (TRUSTNET DAY) 2024 Event description The objective of this day is to allow members of the community to gather and discuss around the themes of Trust and Privacy in networks in general and the algorithmic tools and applications that go with them, in particular. They include presentations by researchers, including PhD students, and industrialists.
For its first edition, we have chosen to make this event on one day. There will be invited talks aimed at a broad audience and shorter talks aimed at presenting recent research on more focused topics, as well as time for informal exchanges.
We particularly encourage young researchers (Ph.D., post-doctoral,…) to participate; it will also be an opportunity to present their work, including work in progress or not yet published.
TARGETED RESEARCH TOPICS Study, Measurement and Use of Trust in and to enhance security and privacy:
Intrusion Detection Certificate Management Migration of network functions to the cloud Study and respect of privacy in :
Machine Learning/Federated Learning Trust and AI in Physical Cyber Systems Trust and privacy management and usability issues in cyber physical systems Technologies for trust and privacy Role of the user in privacy and trust solutions ORGANIZER(S) / MEMBERS OF THE STEERING COMMITTEE OF THE THEMATIC DAY Cristina ONETE, University of Limoges / XLIM

title: Call for participation
content:
Trust and Privacy in Networks (TRUSTNET DAY) Description of the event The objective of this thematic day (or workshop) is to allow members of the community to come together and discuss the themes of Trust, Security and Privacy in networks in general and the algorithmic tools and applications that go with it, in particular.
This day includes presentations by researchers, including PhD students, and industrials.
For its first edition, the organizers have chosen to make this event on one day. There will be guest presentations to a wide audience and shorter presentations to present recent research on more specialized topics, as well as time for informal exchanges.
Topics The targeted topics, related to networks in general, will be:
Study, Measurement and Use of the Trust in and to enhance security and privacy:
Intrusion detection Certificate Management Migration of network functions to the cloud Study and respect of privacy in:
Machine Learning/Federated Learning Trust and AI in Cyber-Physical systems Trust and privacy management and usability issues in cyber-physical systems Trust and privacy technologies User role in privacy and trusted solutions Proceedings The proceedings of the day may be published in a book to be published by River Publisher: https://www.riverpublishers.com/
Registration (deadline May 15th, 2024) Participations are free but registration is mandatory:

title: Organizer(s)
content: Cristina ONETE - University of Limoges, XLIM
